alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Ozark; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 02 at 10:28PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas and Ozark. * WHEN...Until 430 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... North Fork River at County Road 278, Spring Creek at County Road 349, Lick Creek at County Road 528, Big Creek at County Road 390 and South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Willow Springs, Cabool, Gainesville, Summersville, Raymondville, Bakersfield and Pomona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
